overview: From 2025-06-14 to 2025-06-15, elizaos/eliza had 5 new PRs (3 merged), 3 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topIssues.title: /api/agents/{agentId}/rooms -> API endpoint not found
topIssues.author: exitsimulation
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to call the /rooms endpoint on my existing agent and getting a 404:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57206b48-f124-4937-98ba-5914f9e6ca59)

Here you can see that this particular agent exists:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/53b4ace7-4801-497a-ace1-f8dee3569d6d)

I am on version 1.0.9

**To Reproduce**

Create agent, try to GET or POST /rooms on the agendId endpoint

**Expected behavior**

I was expecting to retrieve the rooms of the agent

**Screenshots**

(see above)

** Additional Context **

Both /logs and /memories on this particular agentId are working. Just /rooms returns the 404 "API endpoint not found" on both POST and GET
`http://localhost:3000/api/agents/b8af647b-f617-0ae3-ab07-acb81861d7e2/rooms`

topIssues.title: bedrock

topIssues.body: how I can integrate bedrock as a llm there is no option in the cli

topPRs.title: feat: Split server package from CLI (continued shaw's PR)
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Split server functionality into separate `@elizaos/server` package
- Maintains full backward compatibility with existing CLI integrations
- Enables independent usage of server components
- Updated all CLI imports to use the new server package

## Test plan
- [x] All existing CLI tests pass
- [x] Server package builds and exports correctly
- [x] Backward compatibility maintained
- [x] Integration tests verify CLI + server work together
- [x] Type safety preserved across package boundaries

Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

topPRs.title: Split server into separate package and import back into CLI
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR creates a server package

This lets anyone add a server to their backend without the CLI, which can be handing for creating custom apps and interfaces

I'm using it in a project now where I want to pair down a lot of stuf

topPRs.title: chore: Update Postman collection with missing API endpoints
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
Updated the Postman collection to include all missing API endpoints discovered through comprehensive codebase analysis.

### Changes Made:
- **Enhanced Agent Logs**: Added query parameters for filtering (roomId, type, count, offset, excludeTypes)
- **Channel Agent Management**: Added 3 new endpoints for managing agents in channels
- **Room Management**: Updated room creation with proper request body parameters  
- **Media Upload**: Fixed endpoint path from `/upload` to `/upload-media`
- **TEE Logs**: Updated to query-based format with pagination support

### Technical Details:
- Analyzed all router files in `/packages/cli/src/server/api/` 
- Cross-referenced with existing Postman collection to identify gaps
- Added proper request examples and variable definitions
- Maintained consistent naming and structure with existing endpoints

### Test Plan:
- [ ] Import updated Postman collection
- [ ] Verify all new endpoints have proper request examples
- [ ] Test variable substitution works correctly
- [ ] Confirm authentication setup is preserved
- [ ] Validate endpoint paths match actual API implementation

The Postman collection now accurately reflects the complete ElizaOS API surface.

topPRs.title: fix: file uploading
topPRs.author: tcm390
topPRs.body:
related: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/5116

This PR resolves an issue with media file uploads in the GUI. File uploads are now working as expected.
Note: Media processing features (e.g., transcription, image description) are not included in this update and will be handled separately.

Made significant code changes across 118 files (+14,383/-13,390 lines) with a focus on feature work (50%) and maintained a consistent activity pattern.

tcm390: Merged 2 PRs, including a significant fix for file uploading in PR #5115 (+4381/-3524 lines), and created 1 issue regarding GUI file upload failures (#5116, CLOSED). Maintained a consistent activity pattern with a focus on bug fixes (43%) and made modifications across 71 files (+4382/-3525 lines) through 7 commits.
